name: USIRU Breathing Workshop
description: A transformative 3-hour immersive Neuro-reboot workshop designed to help you recalibrate with your breath, reset dysregulated stress responses, and experience emotional regulation for performance optimisation.Many of us go through life breathing shallowly and unconsciously — leaving our nervous system in a constant state of stress. Usiru Breathwork guides you to re-train your nervous system using breath, scientific, somatic, and meditative tools so you can heal anxiety, calm your mind, and restore inner peace.Under the guidance of Raanika D. Kararia, an experienced breath master and healer, this session integrates breathwork, meditation, energy release, and guided healing techniques to support deep relaxation and enhance resilience and adaptability. We conduct an HRV coherence assessment before and after the breathwork session to measure shifts in autonomic balance. The change in coherence and variability reflects how effectively the practice activates the parasympathetic system. A simple Nervous System Score is also provided to indicate emotional regulation and overall well-being.

name: Around the World in 8 Ragas
description: Across continents and centuries, humanity has carried one universal companion: Music. From desert caravans tracing ancient trade routes, to sailors navigating uncharted seas, to pilgrims and warriors moving across borders, cultures have exchanged not only goods and beliefs—but also sound. “Around the world in 8 Ragas” is a concert that explores how musical scales, though born in different corners of the globe, reveal a shared human instinct for expression.Follow the journeys of iconic scales—Pentatonic, Raga, Maqam, Modes, and more. We uncover how these musical structures spread through Silk Road markets, African diaspora rhythms, medieval monasteries, and colonial crossroads. We invite audiences to listen to history, one Raga at a time.Performers :Ashwin Baliga, Vocals (US-Based Indian Classical vocalist, student of Mahesh Kale and Pt. Milind Chittal, creator of the world's first Raga Bath)Shadaj Godkhindi, Flute (Acclaimed flutist and student of renowned maestro Pt. Pravin Godkhindi)Amit Kavthekar, Tabla (Multi-Genre collaborator and prodigious disciple of Ustad Allah Rakha and Ustad Zakir Hussain)Vivek Santosh, Keys (Trinity-trained Classical pianist with a Masters in Carnatic Music)

name: My Life Closed Twice: Book Launch
description: Author Subhashini Kaligotla launches her new poetry collection My Life Closed Twice (Copper Coin, 2025), with Jeet Thayil.In My Life Closed Twice, Subhashini Kaligotla charts the long aftermath of grief, and its recursive, obsessive cadences. Drawing on premodern India’s art, literature, and history, through invented forms and received ones, in fragments, litanies, lists, and queries, the poems in this spare volume embody the psychological terrain of the grieving. Two premature deaths are at the heart of the book. Kaligotla writes of their immediate aftereffects and their enduring impact. She braids her voice with voices from India’s past—from the unknown bards of the Sanskrit epics who counsel equanimity in the face of catastrophe to the laments of Ashoka, Bilhana, and Jahangir.Author BioSubhashini Kaligotla is a poet and an art historian of ancient and medieval South Asia. She is author of the poetry collection Bird of the Indian Subcontinent and the monograph Shiva’s Waterfront Temples. She teaches at Columbia, dividing her time between New York City and Hyderabad.Advance Praise for My Life Closed TwiceSubhashini Kaligotla’s ingeniously fashioned poetic structures—which are light, flexible, delicate yet possessed of remarkable tensile strength and architectural clarity and integrity—aren’t just beautiful in themselves. They’re also vessels for deep imaginative feeling and thinking and wondering and longing. She has a unique, compelling lyric voice and a distinguished twenty-first century consciousness.-Vijay SeshadriAnger, denial, bargaining, despair, all the stages of grief except acceptance, each stage overlaid with the forensic precision generated by love when it has nowhere to go. These enraged, laceratingly plainspoken poems burn with the singular self-awareness that is the writer's curse, and the writer's gift. Two deaths enclose the book like 'two dates // enclosed / by parentheses'. It is impossible to read, say, 'Only Your Brother Will You Lose' – its fifty shards hammered into the flesh like fifty nine-inch nails – and come away unscathed. -Jeet Thayil

name: Dastan-e-Akhtari
description: About the Performance:Duration: 1 Hour 40 minsLanguage: Hindustani (Hindi-Urdu Mix)Akhtari Bai Faizabadi, also known as Begum Akhtar was a unique singer of her time. In her unique voice and andaz, she produced such hauntingly sweet notes, coupled with her spontaneity, that the audience were immediately captivated. Beginning at the age of Seven, Begum Akhtar kept her audience spellbound for almost six decades.This was Begum Akhtar, the Singer; but her personal journey is equally captivating and inspiring. She was a brave, fiercely independent-minded person, who drew her life path herself amidst the struggles that life threw at her. At a time when the social and political landscape of the country was gradually changing, she set her own standards of life and arts, not withstanding the constraints of times and emerged as a stronger person and better singer by living upto those standards.With all its highs and lows and awws and wows, Dastan-e-Akhtari is the story of the life of the legend of her time and beyond, Begum Akhtar. In this performance, the story of her life will be told by Kafeel Jafri – a Dastango (‘storyteller’ in Urdu), interspersed with rendition of her songs – Ghazals & Thumris by Yusra Naqvi, a trained Hindustani Classical Singer.About the performersYusra Naqvi is a vocalist and instrumentalist, pursuing Alankaar (Masters) in Hindustani classical music from Gandharva under Khushal Sharma and Pt. Madhup Mudgal. She belongs to Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, where she did her schooling and simultaneously learnt classical music from Dr. Rupam Bajpai for six years.Currently a student of History at the Jamia Milia Islamia University, Delhi, she is also a performing artist of khayal, dhamaar, thumri and dadra in the classical genre, and of ghazals and bhajans in light classical music. She learnt Soz and Salaam from elders in her extended family and has been reciting these forms from a young age. Yusra is an enthusiast of Urdu resistance poetry.Yusra will be accompanied by renowned musicians:Kedarnath Havaldar on TablaRooted in the dictum “Swara Matha, Laya Pita,” Kedarnath Havaldar expresses his musical lineage through the tabla. Trained initially in vocal music, his accompaniment reflects the nuances of Khayal gayaki. He trained for over a decade under Pt. Rajgopal Kallurkar and Pt. M. Nagesh, and is currently a disciple of Pt. Samir Chatterjee. His Gurukul training in New York enriched his understanding of tabla in depth. Kedarnath has performed at prestigious venues including Carnegie Hall (NY), World Music Festival (Chicago), London International Festival, and Sawai Gandharva Festival (Pune). His collaborations span international ensembles, Sufi-rock band Junoon, global music productions, and academic initiatives, including teaching “World Rhythms” at Azim Premji University.Sarfaraz Khan on SarangiSarfaraaz Khan, born on 29 January 1996 in Dharwad, hails from the illustrious Kirana Gharana and represents the 9th generation of musicians in his family. His grandfather, Ustad Abdul Khader Khan Sahab, was a sarangi maestro and staff artist at All India Radio, Dharwad, while his great-grandfather, Ustad Sheikh Abdulla Khan, served as a court musician in the Gwalior and Mysore palaces and for the Nizams of Hyderabad. Sarfaraaz’s father, Ustad Faiyaz Khan, is a renowned vocalist and sarangi maestro, under whose guidance Sarfaraaz began training in vocal and sarangi music at the age of four. He later received advanced taalim from Padma Vibhushan Pt. Ram Narayan Ji, with his Gandha Bandhan ceremony held in Mumbai in 2011.An A-grade artist approved by All India Radio, Delhi, Sarfaraaz Khan is the only sarangi player in South India known for his versatility across pure classical and semi-classical music, and for his work in South Indian film title songs and background scores. He has performed at prestigious festivals and institutions across India and abroad, including the Gangubai Hangal Music Foundation, Dharwad Music Festival, Miraj, Bhopal, Singapore, Europe, and the Consulate General of India in Dubai, and has accompanied his father and many eminent maestros. His accolades include the AIR National Award and Acharya Allauddin Khan Memorial Award (2013), Inspiring Indian Youth Icon Award (2017), Yuva Puraskar, and a Silver Medal from Baba Harivallabh Sangeet Sabha (2011).Kafeel Jafri (Writer, Director, Dastango) is a Bangalore-based theatre artist and poet. Trained in theatre acting and techniques by eminent gurus, Kafeel has acted in over 20 theatre productions, one feature film, several short films and ads. He has also translated two plays from English to Hindi.He has also conceptualised and performed shows around Urdu literature. Some of these shows are Life and works of Faiz, An evening of Ghalib and his Ghazals, Manto ki Kahaniyan. His love for Urdu comes from his culturally rich upbringing in Lucknow, especially from the tradition azadari, the mourning tradition of Muharram. As a Dastango, he has performed more than 50 shows of the Classical Dastans. He also teaches acting through workshops for individuals and delivers drama & storytelling-based training in organizations for diversity and inclusion sensitization and Sales. He has also written New Dastans like Dastan-e-Ishq, Dastan-e-Sitayana, Dastan-e-Maseeha and Dastan Yusuf aur Zulekha ki.

name: Shibari Classes For Beginners
description: This is an immersive learning space for people who want to practice Shibari but haven't found the right space, people or facilitator in India to learn from.The goal of these six week courses is to facilitate regular, structured Shibari practice that aims to go deep rather than broad, helping you to develop a really firm grasp of rope bondage fundamentals, build muscle memory, and get to know other participants. The classes will be conducted every Saturday afternoon and will be led by Amiya, Founder of Silly Hands Shibari.The 6-week cohort is limited to a select group of registered participants only. No walk-ins.Each ticket gives you entry for 2 People i.e you + your rope partner. What is Shibari?Shibari is a contemporary form of rope bondage that was originated in Japan in the early 1200-1800's. Later popularized in the 21st century as a pleasure-craft. Shibari, despite its various styles, adheres to a certain aesthetic and exclusively uses ropes as a primary tool to build trust and connect with oneself and others.What to expect?3 hour weekly in-person hands-on lessons100% Vetted ParticipantsJapanese Asanawa (Hemp ropes) for the classFree access to Rope Jams1:1 Technical & Safety guidance throughout the programPost-course integration supportLimited Edition SHS MerchThis is a structured learning space that explores mind–body engagement through rope. The course supports flexibility in awareness, communication, and embodied practice, using rope as a practical and intentional tool. Safety, consent, and consistency remain central to the learning process.We will cover the fundamental knots, frictions, patterns, harnesses, and introduces participants to important skills such as rope handling and tensioning. By the end of the course, participants should understand how to construct a short rope scene that brings together technical and playful elements.Further InformationDates: Every Saturday starting 24th January, 2 pm - 5 pm.Where: The Bangalore Local, Koramangala, Bengaluru.Who can Join :Adults 21+ with no prior experience but plenty interest, LGBTQIA+ solo or with a rope partner.The ticket gives you entry for 2 People i.e you + your rope partner.Participants who sign up solo are encouraged to partner up with another solo-participant to practice the ties on each other. If you don’t want to switch (both tie and be tied), then we would recommend coming with a partner.About the Facilitator: Amiya Bhanushali (she/they) is a queer multidisciplinary artist, contemporary curator and creative strategist. Her work explores art, human connection and design across all disciplines, with a focus on Indian and South Asian narratives. They began to explore Shibari in 2022 as an extension of their art and research into kink-based practices. As their style naturally progressed beyond aesthetics alone, they began to discover interconnections between queerness, pleasure, trauma and neurodivergence.Questions? Email us at sillyhands.shibari@gmail.com

name: Serious Slice
description: Welcome to Naples. Well, almost. At Serious Slice, we take our Napoli roots very seriously. Every dish, every process is driven by a deep obsession with Neapolitan pizza and the streets that shaped it, where time, fire, and simplicity do the heavy lifting.Our dough ferments for 72 hours before it ever meets the flame, creating crusts that are light, airy, and blistered just the way Napoli intended. The tomatoes are always San Marzano, bright and balanced. The mozzarella melts soft and gentle. Every pizza carries the soul of a city that takes its food personally.Whether you swear by the OG Margherita or chase bolder flavours, the craft always remains the constant.At our flagship on Cunningham Road, we’ve kept things honest and unfussy. Walk through the blue doors and you enter a warm, intimate space — mosaic art on the walls with quiet nods to Naples, and the crackle of fire you hear instantly from our open kitchen. No backstage. Just dough, flame, and movement.With just 40 seats and an open kitchen, Serious Slice is intimate, warm, and always led by the food and the craft.Weekends are seriously special: Every weekend, we roll out two limited-edition pizzas that don’t stick around for long. Tartufo-E-Fungi – with button mushrooms, capers, pecorino cheese, and a heady drizzle of truffle oil — earthy, bold, and seriously indulgent. Napoli Salsiccia – with Italian sausage, fresh mozzarella, onion, red paprika, and button mushrooms — smoky, spicy, and unapologetically Napoli. description: Welcome to Naples. Well, almost. At Serious Slice, we take our Napoli roots very seriously. Every dish, every process is driven by a deep obsession with Neapolitan pizza and the streets that shaped it, where time, fire, and simplicity do the heavy lifting.Our dough ferments for 72 hours before it ever meets the flame, creating crusts that are light, airy, and blistered just the way Napoli intended. The tomatoes are always San Marzano, bright and balanced. The mozzarella melts soft and gentle. Every pizza carries the soul of a city that takes its food personally.Whether you swear by the OG Margherita or chase bolder flavours, the craft always remains the constant.At our flagship on Cunningham Road, we’ve kept things honest and unfussy. Walk through the blue doors and you enter a warm, intimate space — mosaic art on the walls with quiet nods to Naples, and the crackle of fire you hear instantly from our open kitchen. No backstage. Just dough, flame, and movement.With just 40 seats and an open kitchen, Serious Slice is intimate, warm, and always led by the food and the craft.Weekends are seriously special: Every weekend, we roll out two limited-edition pizzas that don’t stick around for long. Tartufo-E-Fungi – with button mushrooms, capers, pecorino cheese, and a heady drizzle of truffle oil — earthy, bold, and seriously indulgent. Napoli Salsiccia – with Italian sausage, fresh mozzarella, onion, red paprika, and button mushrooms — smoky, spicy, and unapologetically Napoli. Available only on weekends, and when they’re gone, they’re gone.We’re open every day from 12 PM to 11 PM — perfect for lazy lunches, late dinners, and everything in between. We also roll out frequent off-menu pizza and panuozzo drops — one-day-only creations that appear without warning and disappear just as fast, in limited quantities every time. Follow us so you never miss our flavour drops. We take loyalty seriously: Collect stamps on your Serious Passport and chase the flavour. Ask our staff to give you our loyalty card - to win free panuozzos and pizzas of your choosing. Please Note: We’re a 40-seater, so reservations are recommended on weekends. Limited specials and collab menus are first-come, first-served. Panuozzos take a little extra time — they’re worth the wait. Special events and collabs may run on timed seating.Serious Slice, Cunningham Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka.

name: En-Visioning 2026: The Art of Beginning Again
description: What to Expect:Find yourself immersed in a space curated completely to have you meditate on your values & the things you want to make your goals.You will be guided by spiritual guide & forever warm bonfire, Meghna Dixit, someone who I take immense pride in knowing for her humanity, calm & creativity.This workshop will meld together the practices of -GratitudeJournallingMeditationRituals of Release and,ManifestationIn a seamless 2.5 hour workshop, Meghna will take you through a retrospective of things you were grateful about in 2025; and the means to get real about what Values you would like to carry over to 2026, to bring your dreams to reality.Who Is It For:This workshop is for those who would like to:Put in the work for some quiet introspectionBe ready to take on their limiting beliefsAre willing to dreamAnd hold themselves accountable for their actionsWhether you're someone whose NEVER vision boarded before, or have, and it's been a while, this guided vision boarding exercise to imagine your greatest goals & dreams for 2026 is probably exactly what you need before the new year begins.We've got very limited spots for this one, if we find enough interest, we may be able to convince Meghna to come host another one but it will only be in the New Year!What to Bring:Just your presence, your dreams & your self. Absolutely nothing else!Please make sure you plan to arrive on time, we'd like to have everyone in the room before we begin.What you will get:A physical vision board to take home with you at the end of the workshopAccess to a meditative & guided vision boarding exerciseAn introduction to other manifestors, friends, accountabuddies evenAll the necessary tools to allow you to retrospect on 2025, but also to dream big for yourself in 2026.About the Organiser:Meghna Dixit is a deeply spiritual earthling.You will also find her keen eye for detail, enamouring, and her taste for aesthetics something to absolutely fight for.But outside of her her keen eye for detail & her taste, she's a practicing guide for the Dances of Universal Peace in Bangalore, and has now led a fair few Women's Retreats & Meditative Photography Workshops.Her presence & spirituality is bound to have you tap into something peaceful, accepting, visionary & beautiful for the last weekend of the year!How to find us:For a hassle-free arrival -Our address:3rd Floor, Eterna, 80 Feet Rd, KHB Colony, Industrial Area, Properties,#9, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 5600951. Make sure you enter away center as a location on your ride service, or Y AXIS, Koramangala.2. We are in the corner building after McDonald's3. You should be able to find us on. most search results, but feel free to contact us if notWhy your ticket is priced this way:It is currently split at an 80-20% split in favour of Meghna for her time spent & expertise with crafting "En-Visioning 2026"There is also, a lucky for us, 18% GST on all tickets above 500Rs.So, now that you know, you should hit that "Pay!" button!In case you need any assistance or have questions, feel free to contact us. We look forward to welcoming you to this meditative, reflective & rejuvenating event!

organizer.description: an elevated wellness-centric coworking space that doubles up as a community center with carefully curated events.

name: Let’s Walk - Book Launch by Prakash Kannan
description: Join us for an intimate evening at Atta Galatta as we celebrate the launch of "Let’s Walk" by Prakash Kannan. This is more than just a book release; it is an invitation to explore the quiet, lingering moments that define our lives.The Story: "Let’s Walk" is a poignant tale of two strangers brought together by chance. Set against the rhythmic backdrop of city life, the story explores the beauty of timing, the weight of unspoken words, and the type of love that stays with you long after the final page.The Event Experience:· A Sneak Peek: Get an exclusive look into the heart of the story.· Meet the Author: Hear Prakash Kannan share his creative journey and the deep emotions that inspired this book.· Q&A: A chance to ask the author about the themes of timing and connection.Location: Atta Galatta, Indira Nagar, Bengaluru Date: January 10, 2026 Time: 05:30 PM

name: Meenu the Meemi- Book Launch
description: A dream dialogue with a little fish, Meenu, changes Nandu's life and gives him a purpose. As he decides to champion a rare cause with grit and determination, he faces many hurdles. Will Nandu succeed in his mission? What is this mission that Nandu has taken up? Who helps him on the way? To know more read, Meenu the Meemi, a dream fantasy about how a little fish befriends a little boy and how it changes lives of many others. * Free entry so no tickets to the event.

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Quiet Joys: A Gratitude Zine–Making Workshop
description: Join us for an afternoon of quiet creativity. This workshop invites you to slow down, reflect on the small joys that often go unnoticed, and turn those moments into an 8-page gratitude zine. Through gentle prompts and simple illustration exercises, you’ll create a personal keepsake that captures what grounded you, moved you, or made you smile. It’s a reflective, hands-on session for anyone seeking a pause through creativity and mindful noticing. All materials will be provided, and no prior art experience is required.

name: The NYE Block Party
description: THE NYE BLOCK PARTY — 9 ARTISTS. 6 ROOMS. 1 EPIC NIGHT. Step into Bengaluru’s most dynamic New Year’s Eve celebration — The NYE Block Party at Evergreen House. Six immersive spaces come alive across one vibrant block, each pulsing with its own sound, energy, and style. From neon-lit house beats to intimate blues sessions, Bollywood jams to karaoke chaos, this is your passport to the ultimate city-wide vibe — all in one place.Explore the Experience:The Penthouse – Take it to the top with K’OD, Shayzen, and Avara spinning high-energy house, afro, and electronic bangers all night long. Manhattan glamour meets champagne sparkle.The Immersion Room – A sensory playground by Devoid, fusing visuals and sound into an otherworldly, underground experience.The Live Room (Pizza Express) – From 8 to 11 PM, groove to a soulful Bollywood-Sufi fusion set by The Original Gupta with Rohan JMidnight Blue – The Drafting Room – A vintage speakeasy mood with Butterfingers BLR, an old-school blues duo who bring warmth, grit, and groove.The Deck (Blue Tokai) – Get in the groove along with House/Funk DJ setsThe Vinyl Bar – Deep cuts and vinyl magic with DJ Tapan Raj behind the decks. Secret spot. Timeless vibe.Chef Goku, CIA-trained and New York–honed across Michelin-starred kitchens, brings his global edge to the city.Currently touring India with bold pop-up dining experiences rooted in local ingredients and international flair.This New Year’s Eve, he curates a Manhattan-inspired culinary and cocktail experience at Love Ooru’s rooftop penthouse.As midnight hits, expect NYC flavors, champagne moments, and high-energy vibes—right here at Love Ooru.Sip on Toit beer, wine, sake, soju, and cocktails throughout the evening.Entry & Cover:Female Stag: 2000 (Full Cover)The Penthouse, The Deck and The Immersion RoomMale Stag: 4000 (Full Cover)The Penthouse, The Deck and The Immersion RoomCouple Entry: 4000 (Full Cover)The Penthouse, The Deck and The Immersion Room(Add on pass) 1000 ( Full cover)Midnight Blue and The Vinyl RoomBasic: ₹1000 (₹800 Cover) Entry to The Live Room - Pizza ExpressDress to impress, dance without limits, and countdown with the city’s finest.Welcome 2026 in style at Evergreen House — The NYE Block Party.

name: Bengaluru Starter Pack with Tasty Trivia
description: The Bengaluru Starter Pack — now a game showThis edition is an ode to Bengaluru — its hills and lakes, gardens and grids, architecture and evolution. Expect a mix of questions exploring how the city was planned and shaped, from its early contours and colonial designs to modern neighbourhoods, public art, and everyday quirks that define “Namma Bengaluru.”Here’s what’s on the menu 👇🤝 Welcoming vibe — friendly, engaging, and beginner-friendly.🇮🇳 India-themed set — food, culture, films, people, business & more.🧩 Work-outable questions — designed to be solved with thinking, not rote recall.🧃 Welcome Drinks (Prelims): fun warm-up round (10–12 Qs, ~30–45 mins).🍛 Appraiser: fast-paced face-offs & eliminations.🍲 Main Course: top teams battle it out on a Jeopardy-style grid.🙌 Audience play-along: submit guesses live & win prizes too.🏆 Goodies galore: for both audiences & winnersWho is Tasty Trivia?Tasty Trivia is co-curated by Susovan and Saloni, driven by a shared love for curiosity. A multi-city, community-driven series, it has travelled across 5 cities and runs monthly in Bangalore — offering fun, beginner-friendly trivia events that make knowledge social, engaging, and full of surprises.

location.address: 3rd Floor, above Blue Tokai, #24 3rd A Cross, 1st Main Rd, Defence Colony, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India
